text: thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>. Any reason why they wouldn't be in the same flow? It feels to me it would be easier to replicate for each new webinar. You would just need to deal with 1.

Well would both groups of people fit the same enrollment criteria? Or a very similar criteria? If so you could definitely make it 1 flow with a branch. I just tend to lean toward building concise workflows

Hello :wave:

Is it possible to _*associate conversation with contact*_ using workflow custom code?

Hello Everyone,  is there a way to pass a value as a parameter to custom code action in HubSpot workflows, would like to have workflow editors passing this hardcoded value outside the custom code , so editors don't miss with code.
for some reason all my workflows are not shown, i’m not seeing anything in my workflows page
you could do it through a format data action. Basically just setting the variable in as a string and then using the output in the custom coded action input
But this is a little hacky
I would suggest just having a variables section at the very top of the Custom coded action

Thank you Carter for the suggestion, the format data action expect you to pick a property from contact object as an example, I don't want to do that, All I want is to pass a hard coded value as parameter to the workflow as an example state value "California" to be used in the custom code!. Again I would like it to not be as a variable in the custom code but rather outside the custom code set by workflow editors. then I could use that in the code section.
